creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 26067
Suggested patch to fix project rename

Patches to rename XML-Security (and XML Security) as Santuario

creator: cantor.2@osu.edu
text:
Santuario is the Apache project name, but I have no plans to change the C++ library name. Actually, I'll put that more firmly...I will not. The Java side is free to do that if they prefer.

I'm happy to change any references to the Apache project as a whole in the sources, of course, and will check the patch for that.

OK, in that case I suggest that you make the naming convention clear on the history page, which currently says:

"In 2006, the XML-Security was voted as an Apache TLP and was rebranded as Apache Santuario."

The sentence could do with rewording anyway, as it does not read very well at present.
creator: sebb@apache.org
cantor.2@osu.edu
text: Agree, I'd suggest "In 2006, the XML-Security project was voted as an Apache TLP and was rebranded as Apache Santuario. The Santuario project at present includes the Java and C++ XML-Security library projects."
